subject: linear_algebra
title: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors Defined
contentHtml:
Eigenvalues and eigenvectors are fundamental concepts in linear algebra that help us understand how matrices transform vectors.

Intuitively, an eigenvalue is a scalar that represents the amount of stretching or shrinking a matrix applies to a vector, while an eigenvector is the direction along which this transformation occurs.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors Defined
contentHtml:
Eigenvalues and eigenvectors are fundamental concepts in linear algebra that help us understand how matrices transform vectors.

Geometrically, an eigenvector is a non-zero vector that, when transformed by the matrix, results in a scaled version of itself. The scaling factor is called the eigenvalue.
name: Eigenvalue Equation" },
intuition: Think of eigenvectors as directions in which a matrix stretches or shrinks, while eigenvalues represent the amount of stretching or shrinking.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors Defined
contentHtml:
Eigenvalues and eigenvectors are fundamental concepts in linear algebra, used to describe the behavior of matrices.

Geometrically, an eigenvector is a non-zero vector that does not change direction when transformed by a matrix, while its corresponding eigenvalue represents the amount of scaling applied during this transformation.
name: Eigenvalue Equation" },
problemHtml: Find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a matrix A.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Compute the characteristic polynomial", "mathHtml": "\[p(\lambda) = \det(A - \lambda I)\]", "explanation": "This helps us find the eigenvalues."} ],
intuition: Understanding eigenvalues and eigenvectors is crucial for many machine learning and AI applications, such as dimensionality reduction, feature extraction, and data compression.
